  1. What's Happening in Lake Stevens
    Stay Informed and Connected


  1. Latest News
  1. Latest News

  1. Splash!

    Dive in to learn about what is going on around the lake. Read on...

  2. HarvestFest 2025 Event Survey

    A thank you and an event survey for the community. Read on...

  3. WinterFest 2025

    The City's annual event returns to North Cove Park, on Saturday, December 14, 2025, from 4 - 7 pm. Read on...

  4. Cavalero Community and Sport Center RFP

    The City is soliciting interested firms to bid on the Cavalero Community and Sport Center project. Read on...

  5. Meet up with the Mayor

    Community members are invited to join Mayor Brett Gailey at the Starbucks next to MOD Pizza at Frontier Village in Lake Stevens in November. Read on...

  6. City Offices Closed To Observe Veterans Day

    City offices will be closed on Tuesday, November 11, 2025, to observe Veterans Day. Read on...

  7. Frontier Heights Park Closure

    To complete the Phase II construction project, Frontier Heights Park will be closed November 3, 2025 - February 2026. Read on...

  8. Volunteer Opportunity with Planning Commission

    The City is seeking to fill one vacancy on the Planning Commission. Read on...

  9. Cavalero Hill Park Ownership Transfer

    Effective October 20, 2025, The City of Lake Stevens owns and manages Cavalero Hill Park. Read on...

  10. PROS Plan Open House

    The community is invited to the PROS Plan open house on November 10 at The Mill on Lake Stevens in North Cove Park. Read on...

  11. Main Street Construction Project Information

    Significant progress has been made, and completion is anticipated to be by the end of the year! Read on...

  12. Lake Stevens Plan for Salmonid Basins

    We need your help through this planning effort! Read on...

  13. Online Auction

    The online auctions will open November 11 and 12, 2025. Read on...

  14. New Business License Fees become effective 1/1/2026!

    Read about the upcoming changes to the City's business license fees... Additional Info...

  15. Join Us at The Mill's Open House

    Are you planning an upcoming event and are looking for a venue? Stop by The Mill's Open House on Thursday, November 13, 6 - 8 pm. Read on...

  16. Snohomish County Parks Passes Will No Longer Be Accepted at Davies Beach

    Snohomish County Parks boat launch access passes will no longer be accepted at Davies Beach, after December 31, 2025. Read on...

  17. The City's first PROS Plan

    Learn more about the City's 10-year vision for our parks, open spaces, trails, and recreational programming. Read on...

  18. The Discover Pass Will No Longer Be Accepted at North Cove Boat Launch

    The Discover Pass will no longer be accepted at the North Cove boat launch, after November 30, 2025. Read on...

  19. Lost an item at a Lake Stevens Park?

    Contact the Parks and Recreation Department for items lost at our Parks. Read on...

  20. Splash!

    Dive in to learn about what is going on around the lake. Read on...

  21. HarvestFest 2025 Event Survey

    A thank you and an event survey for the community. Read on...
